abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan for Pakistan was satisfactory. The project
            achieved most of its objectives, its impact on institutional
            development was substantial, sustainability is likely, and
            the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, where stabilization is a precondition for
            other policy reforms, treat it as such, rather than as a
            parallel and independent target. Second, the Bank and
            Borrower should focus on a few key conditions, clarifying
            any sequencing issues and their interrelationships. Third,
            where major reforms are contemplated, break them into phases
            with the expectation of a follow-up program and loan to
            follow should the first phase be implemented successfully.
            Fourth, the Bank and Government should carefully assess the
            capacity of the agencies to implement new activities. Fifth,
            the audience for discussing reforms through seminars, study
            tours, and written information should be broadened. Sixth,
            clearly monitorable targets and conditions should be defined
            to reduce debate during implementation about the meaning of
            targets and conditions. Seventh, when there are no
            overriding sequencing issues, have upfront action on the
            most important conditions. Finally, conditionalities should
            be defined in a manner that targets the real variables under
            the program rather than intermediate variables.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Adjustment Loan
            Project will support the Government's program for
            financial sector reform. The reform is accompanied by a
            medium-term macroeconomic adjustment program. The Financial
            Sector Adjustment Loan Project will serve as an umbrella
            under which the needed financial sector reforms will be
            undertaken. Under this loan the Government will introduce a
            system to auction Government debt, raise concessional rates
            of interest, and limit directed credit schemes. Further to
            this, the Government will recapitalize and restructure the
            nationalized commercial banks, improve prudential
            regulations and bank supervision, increase the autonomy and
            accountability of the nationalized commercial banks, and
            allow private domestic banks to enter the market.
